reviews.review_msg: Hudson's background brought to class such a wide range of ideas and examples. It was my first time being exposed to Visual Anthropology and I was impressed! As as second year student, I wish there were more structure though.

He definitely knows his stuff...so well, sometimes I'm lost (as I don't have a Arts background.) But what an interesting class. Such an eye-opener! Got me into visual arts, films and film festivals since! As long as you show up to class and attempt the assignments, you are sure to get good grades.

Hudson has an obvious passion for his subject. As English is not his only language, he was able to introduce foreign source material that brought us the richness of additional cultures. His ability to address ideas promoted stimulating discussions encouraging me to see things from new personal perspectives. Difficult concepts made understandable.

Hudson is a sexy guy and really cool. He is super sweet and everyone should take his class. He is knowledgeable and very accessible and always willing to sit down and work through something with a student. He keep the atmosphere fun and enjoyable. Just like class should be! He challenges you to think about the material. A great prof.

He is an easy marker, but completely useless at teaching. There is a language barrier that I believe makes it difficult for him to translate what he wants from his students. He is never clear about what he wants for his assignments. He knows what he wants in his in his head but has no idea of how to articulate it.
